Package tools.log

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.log.Logger
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultLogger, NullLogger, ThreadLogger
    public abstract class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class for log classes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Logger.Type
      Enum class denoting the severity type of a log action.

    • Field Summary

      The header to print before writing data.
      protected java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock lock
      The lock of each logger.
      protected static boolean useFull
      Whether to use the full exception notation as default or not.
      protected static boolean useTimeStamp
      Whether to use a time stamp by default or not.

    • Method Detail

      • formatDate

        protected static java.lang.String formatDate​(java.util.Date timeStamp)
        Formats the date using the date format
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - the time stamp to be converted.
        Returns:
        A string representing the date.

      • checkType

        protected static Logger.Type checkType​(Logger.Type type)
        Checks the given type on null values.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to be checked. May be null.
        Returns:
        The provided type if type != null. Logger.Type.NONE otherwise.

      • writeE

        protected void writeE​(java.lang.Exception e,
                      java.util.Date timeStamp)
        Writes the exception to a log file.
        It is given that type != null and timeStamp != null.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to be written.
        timeStamp - The time stamp in milliseconds precision.

      • writeE

        protected abstract void writeE​(java.lang.Exception e,
                               Logger.Type type,
                               java.util.Date timeStamp)
        Writes the exception to a log file.
        It is given that type != null and timeStamp != null.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to be written.
        type - The severity type. The default is Logger.Type.ERROR.
        timeStamp - The time stamp in milliseconds precision.

      • writeO

        protected void writeO​(java.lang.Object obj,
                      java.util.Date timeStamp)
        Writes the object to a log file.
        It is given that type != null and timeStamp != null.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be written.
        timeStamp - The time stamp in milliseconds precision.

      • writeO

        protected abstract void writeO​(java.lang.Object obj,
                               Logger.Type type,
                               java.util.Date timeStamp)
        Writes the object to a log file.
        It is given that type != null and timeStamp != null.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be written.
        type - The severity type.
        timeStamp - The time stamp in milliseconds precision.

      • writeOA

        protected void writeOA​(java.lang.Object[] objArr,
                       java.util.Date timeStamp)
        Writes an object array to a log file. Ensures that all data is logged consecutively.
        It is given that type != null and timeStamp != null.
        Parameters:
        objArr - The object array to be written.
        timeStamp - The time stamp in milliseconds precision.

      • writeOA

        protected void writeOA​(java.lang.Object[] objArr,
                       Logger.Type type,
                       java.util.Date timeStamp)
        Writes an object array to a log file. Ensures that all data is logged consecutively.
        It is given that type != null and timeStamp != null.
        Parameters:
        objArr - The object array to be written.
        type - The severity type.
        timeStamp - The time stamp in milliseconds precision.

      • close

        protected abstract void close()
        Closes the log file and releases system resources.

      • flush

        protected abstract void flush()
        Flushes the writer.

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Exception e)
        Delegates the static write action to the default logger instance.
        See Also:

                         Logger.Type type)

        public static void write​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Delegates the static write action to the default logger instance.
        See Also:
        writeO(Object, Date)

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Object obj,
                         Logger.Type type)
        Delegates the static write action to the default logger instance.
        See Also:
        writeO(Object, Type, Date)

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Object[] objArr)
        Delegates the static write action to the default logger instance.
        Ensures that all data is logged consecutively and with the same time stamp.
        Parameters:
        objArr - the object array to be logged.
        See Also:
        writeOA(Object[], Date)

      • write

        public static void write​(java.lang.Object[] objArr,
                         Logger.Type type)
        Delegates the static write action to the default logger instance.
        Ensures that all data is logged consecutively.
        Parameters:
        objArr - the object array to be logged.
        See Also:
        writeOA(Object[], Type, Date)

        public static void closeLog()
        Closes the logger and releases system resources.
        See Also:
        close()

      • flushLog

        public static void flushLog()
        Flushes the writer.

      • setUsagetimeStamp

        public static void setUsagetimeStamp​(boolean useTimeStamp)
        Changes whether to use the time stamp.
        Parameters:
        useTimeStamp - Whether to use the time stamp or not.

      • setUsageFull

        public static void setUsageFull​(boolean useFull)
        Changes whether to use the full log notation.
        Parameters:
        useFull - whether to use the full notation or not.

      • getLog

        public static Logger getLog()
        Returns:
        the default logger.

      • setDefaultLogger

        public static void setDefaultLogger​(Logger log)
        Parameters:
        log - the default logger.

      • setShutDownMessage

        public static void setShutDownMessage​(java.lang.Object msg)
        Sets the message that will be logged when the application shuts down. Use msg == null to prevent any message to be written. Additionally, no message will be printed if no default log is selected.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be logged.

      • setShutDownMessage

        public static void setShutDownMessage​(java.lang.Object msg,
                                      Logger.Type type)
        Sets the message that will be logged when the application shuts down. Use msg = null to prevent any message to be written. Additionally, no message will be printed if no default log is selected.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be logged.
        type - The severity type of the message. The default type is Logger.Type.INFO.

      • getShutDownMessage

        public static java.lang.Object getShutDownMessage()
        Returns:
        The message that will be logged when the application shuts down.

      • getShutDownType

        public static Logger.Type getShutDownType()
        Returns:
        The type of the message that will be logged when the application shuts down.

      • setDateFormat

        public static void setDateFormat​(java.lang.String format)
        Sets the date format for logging.
        Parameters:
        format - The format used for a SimpleDateFormat.

      • setDateFormat

        public static void setDateFormat​(java.text.DateFormat df)
        Sets the date format for logging. Use null to reset to default.
        Parameters:
        df - The date format used for logging.

      • getDateFormat

        public static java.text.DateFormat getDateFormat()
        Returns:
        The date format used to log the date.

      • setLogHeader

        public static void setLogHeader​(java.lang.String header)
        Sets the log header.
        Use null to have no header.
        Use &date& to use the time stamp of when the log was created.
        Parameters:
        header - The header to print before writing data
